definition: Heaven rewards the diligent. (idiom)
day/sky/heaven

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
to entertain/to repay/to return/to reward/to compensate/to reply/to answer

diligent/industrious/hardworking/frequent/regular/constant

sentences.english: I believe God will help me, too. will you bless me, too?
sentences.chinese: 相信天道酬勤，你会祝福我吗？

sentences.english: New opportunities and challenges in the next, God rewards the diligent.
sentences.chinese: 在新的机遇和挑战下，天道酬勤。

sentences.english: I believe that the God rewards the diligent.
I always work hard because I know that God reward those who work hard.
sentences.chinese: 我一直在努力，因为我深信天道酬勤的道理。

definition: you get what you put in/you reap what you sow

definition: a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: hardworking/diligent
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
there is nothing the determined person can't accomplish (idiom)/persistence will overcome
pinyin: shi4 shang4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
related.word: 世上无难事，只怕有心人

definition: mastery of study lies in diligence (idiom). You can only master a subject by assiduous study./Excellence in work is only possible with diligence./Practice makes perfect.
one cannot achieve glory and wealth without having been through trials and tribulations (proverb)/no pain, no gain
pinyin: chi1 de2 ku3 zhong1 ku3 , fang1 wei2 ren2 shang4 ren2
related.word: 吃得苦中苦，方为人上人

definition: assiduous/taking great pains
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
no end to learning (idiom); There's always something new to study./You live and learn.
lit. the clumsy bird flies early (idiom); fig. to work hard to compensate for one's limited abilities
sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis
to strive unremittingly/self-improvement
with great virtue one can take charge of the world (idiom)
to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
